name: mrcssvd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c2)), wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c2)), wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c2)), wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cmrc, c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c2)))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cmrc, c3))

comment: The Moore closure of a set is a subset of the base. Deduction form of ~ mrcssv . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
